comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: This aircraft is still exists and is flying fifty years after it was built. Douglas AD-5 / A-1E Skyraider Bu No 135178 in Light Gull Gray and Insignia White with NAVAL AEROSPACE MEDICAL INSTITUTE across vertical tailplane, RESEARCH on fin top plus PENSACOLA below NAVY on rear fuselage and 178 on engine cowling. On nose of inner wing pylon auxiliary fuel tanks are letters NAMI. Behind is a USAF Lockheed T-33 jet trainer. NAMI internet webpage: www.med.navy.mil/sites/navmedmpte/nomi/nami/Pages/AboutNA... Some history of 135178 (c/n 10255) gleaned from this and other internet websites: www.warbirdregistry.org/a1registry/a1-135178.html Naval Aerospace Medical Institute USMC Museum, MCAS Quantico, Virginia, June 18, 1971-1974. First registered as N62466 with Doug Champlin Collection of Enid, Oklahoma, 1974. The aircraft has passed has through several hands; John Downing, 1975. Don Hendrick, South Carolina, 1976-1981. Airlift Inc, 1983. Paul O'Connell, Dona, Texas, July 1983. Peter W. Thelen, Fort Lauderdale, Florida, January 1984-1985. Lone Star Flight Museum, Houston, Texas, April 1986-1987. Peter W. Thelen, Fort Lauderdale, 1988-1989. Taylor Energy Co, New Orleans, Louisiana, 1990-2002. Douglas A-1E Skyraider Bu No 135178 is currently owned by Eric Downing of Saint Charles, Missouri MIDWEST WILD RELICS REFUGE INC (Corporation) Flown under ‘Experimental’ certificate as N62466 and based at Creve Coeur Airport, St Louis, Missouri . Painted overall in Glossy Sea Blue and marked as ‘135178 Marines 31/MR’. As of year 2011 this aircraft is still flying. There are many pictures of this heritage aircraft available to view on the internet. Dedicated internet webpage to Douglas AD-5 / A-1E Skyraider 135178: www.warbirddepot.com/aircraft_attack_ea1e-downing.asp
